channel.title: CNET News
channel.description: CNET news editors and reporters provide top technology news, with investigative reporting and in-depth coverage of tech issues and events.

item.title: Apple says its App Store hit new records in 2019 - CNET
item.description: The tech giant says app sales between Christmas Eve and New Year's in 2019 grew 16% over the past year.
item.dc:creator: Ian Sherr

item.title: Here's Ford Mustang Shelby GT500 VIN 001 that raised $1.1 million for charity - Roadshow
item.description: The first production Shelby GT500 will be on display at the Barrett-Jackson Scottsdale auction this month.
item.dc:creator: Steven Ewing

item.title: TikTok flaws could have let hackers text you malware - CNET
item.description: Don't worry. They've been patched.
item.dc:creator: Laura Hautala

item.title: Mercedes-Benz Vision AVTR is Pandora on four wheels - Roadshow
item.description: You've never seen a more organic concept than this.
item.dc:creator: Tim Stevens

item.title: At CES 2020, stroke survivors can have rehab that's fun and engaging - CNET
item.description: Neofect Smart Balance is a Dance Dance Revolution-like device for rehabilitation of your legs, balance and posture
item.dc:creator: Patrick Holland

item.title: Forget the Asus ROG Phone 2 -- this gaming phone has ridiculous specs - CNET
item.description: The powerful Black Shark 2 Pro gaming phone from Xiaomi makes a rare US appearance at CES, and we got to spend a little time with it.
item.dc:creator: Patrick Holland

item.title: Boeing now says 737 Max pilots need simulator time - CNET
item.description: The recommendation is a reversal from the company's previous position that existing 737 crews needed only iPad-based training to fly the plane.
item.dc:creator: Kent German

item.title: This mop and vacuum robot cleans itself so you don't have to - CNET
item.description: Narwal wants to give Roomba a run for its money with a self-cleaning feature.
item.dc:creator: Alison DeNisco Rayome

item.title: CES 2020 day 2: Watch our livestream from Vegas, all day Wednesday - CNET
item.description: CES is still going strong, and CNET has another full day of live programming so you can see it all.
item.dc:creator: John Falcone

item.title: The PlayStation 5 logo reveal was the biggest flex of CES 2020 - CNET
item.description: Commentary: It was a flex so savage it bent space and time.
item.dc:creator: Mark Serrels

item.title: At CES 2020, Verizon vows to release 20 5G devices this year - CNET
item.description: Ronan Dunne, the CEO of Verizon Wireless, tells CNET that some of these devices will arrive below $600.
item.dc:creator: Roger Cheng

item.title: Toyota's Woven City project looks amazing in these renderings - Roadshow
item.description: This town is intended to be a settlement of the future -- one that's green, smart and super connected.
item.dc:creator: Craig Cole

item.title: Ivanka Trump says she's 'a big believer in innovation' at CES 2020 amid controversy - CNET
item.description: The president's daughter and advisor to the Trump administration made an appearance at the biggest consumer tech show in the world.
item.dc:creator: Corinne Reichert

item.title: Moodify wants you to follow your nose to safer driving - Roadshow
item.description: An Israeli company says it's figured out how to use special fragrances to block foul odors and even alter human behavior.
item.dc:creator: Craig Cole

item.title: Tomb Raider, Worms and other retro video games to appear on UK stamps - CNET
item.description: Royal Mail stamps celebrate classic video games from UK designers.
item.dc:creator: Bonnie Burton

item.title: CES opens to more sex tech, Samsung's Neon chat bots and Ivanka Trump - CNET
item.description: And Google wants to dominate your smart home. Here's all the cool stuff from CES so far.
item.dc:creator: Kent German

item.title: At CES, Facebook argues it's just as good on privacy as Apple - CNET
item.description: A privacy panel at the giant tech conference underscores how crucial the topic has become.
item.dc:creator: Alfred Ng

item.title: Alienware Concept UFO shows why portable games are better than streaming (for now) - CNET
item.description: Commentary: The Switch Lite is cool, but have you ever tried a Switch Thicc?
item.dc:creator: Daniel Van Boom

item.title: The Amazfit Bip is back at CES... along with earbuds and a treadmill - CNET
item.description: Huami wants to be the next health tech powerhouse, starting with a lot of watches, earbuds and gym equipment.
item.dc:creator: Scott Stein

item.title: CNET's CES 2020 Next Big Thing Panel focuses on anticipatory tech's wonders and dangers - CNET
item.description: Panelists from Google and other companies offer a sense of how smart home systems can work together and determine our needs before we do, but that's not always a good thing.
item.dc:creator: Sean Keane

item.title: I chatted with a Neon avatar, and it doesn't yet live up to the hype - CNET
item.description: I saw the first public demo of the lifelike avatar from Samsung, and it was choppy. I even got to talk with a Neon avatar. There's lots of reasons for both doubt and optimism.
item.dc:creator: Andrew Gebhart

item.title: CES 2020: All of the new smart home products, from smart locks to the Alexa shower head - CNET
item.description: As usual, the connected home is a huge deal at the year's biggest tech show. Here's a running list of the most interesting new devices we'll be tracking in 2020.
item.dc:creator: Rich Brown

item.title: The biggest and best TVs of CES 2020 - CNET
item.description: From a 292-inch MicroLED to OLEDs that roll up (and down), CES has more big screens than any place on Earth this week.
item.dc:creator: Ty Pendlebury

item.title: With D780, Nikon finally shows fans of its midrange DSLR some love - CNET
item.description: It has much improved live view capabilities, because Nikon's learned from mirrorless.
item.dc:creator: Lori Grunin

item.title: Samsung expects another steep decline in fourth-quarter profit - CNET
item.description: Operating profit is expected to drop 34% for the quarter, on top of a 29% decline in the year-ago quarter.
item.dc:creator: Steven Musil
